intro: Sticherus brevitomentosus, commonly known as the short-hairy sticherus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a thalloid plant characterized by a flat, ribbon-like stem covered in short, fine hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophores, are often clustered near the base of the stem. Sticherus brevitomentosus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
